questions.question_text: Which two metadata changes can be made directly in a production environment without deploying from a sandbox? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A and D are the only changes that can be made directly in the environment, without havind to deploy it.

Selected Answer: BC
BC
A--To include all data in a Full sandbox, choose whether and how much field tracking history data to include, and whether to copy Chatter data. So Chatter data is not copied by default.
C- Salesforce automatically changes sandbox usernames, but not passwords. 
B - New sandboxes have the default email deliverability setting System email only. The System email only setting is especially useful for controlling email sent from sandboxes so that testing and development work doesn’t send test emails to your users.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.data_sandbox_create.htm&type=5

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true when a new full sandbox is created? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Default e-mail deliverability is set to system e-mail only.
choices.D: Users' e-mail addresses will not be modified.
choices.C: Usernames will be modified uniquely for that sandbox.
choices.A: Chatter data will be copied to the sandbox by default.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is right.

C: Full Copy - may be refreshed every 29 days, include a full copy of production data and Sandbox Templates may be used but not required. Typically used for Quality Assurance (QA) and/or User Acceptance Testing (UAT) at the very end of development life cycle before deploying changes to production.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=000338970&type=1

choices.A: Whenever a new Production user is added.
choices.B: Within 3 hours of when it is needed.

questions.question_text: When is it recommended to refresh a Full sandbox?
Which capabilities should an app builder consider when creating custom report types?

discussion.content:
D: After you save a report type, you can't change the primary object.
If the primary object on a report type is a custom or external object, and that object is deleted, the report type and reports created from it are deleted.

https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.reports_defining_report_types.htm&type=5

B is not correct due to this page: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.reports_defining_report_types.htm&type=5

"You can choose from all objects—even the objects that you don't have permission to view. This flexibility lets you build report types for a variety of users."

comments.content: Because the user will be able to see the report, but no the data if he doesn't have permission.

discussion.content:
B also seems true. Can someone explain why not B?
I agree D is for sure true.

choices.C: When the primary object is a custom object and is deleted, then the report type and any reports created from it must be deleted manually.
choices.D: Once a report type is saved with a standard or custom primary object, the primary object cannot be changed for that report type.
choices.B: Any object can be chosen unless the object is not visible to the person creating the report type through security settings.
choices.A: The detail object in a Master-Detail relationship cannot be added as a secondary object on a custom report type.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers wants to automatically assign a specific permission set to new users.
Which two actions should be completed in order to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Yes, only FLOW and PROCESS BUILDER have the capability to set permission sets via APEX. Correct Answers are B and D.

Selected Answer: BD
B and D are right.

choices.C: Create an Approval process on the User object to assign a permission set.
choices.A: Create a workflow rule on the User object to assign a permission set.
choices.D: Create a Flow on the User object to assign a permission set.
choices.B: Create a Process on the User object to launch a flow.
